result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant April K Garcia in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for April K Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. No offer, discovery received. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant April K Garcia in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for April K Garcia.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
2:19 PM (64-05) 22CF428 & 22CF430 Defendant April K Garcia in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for April K Garcia.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Samuel Berg in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Deputy Caleb Broege.
Caleb Broege duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg.
Witness has identified the defendant in court.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed in court.
Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
2:22PM - Cross examination by Atty Ryan.
2:25PM - 22CF430
State called to the stand as a witness Deputy David McMillan.
David McMillan duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
Cross examination by Atty Ryan.
Evidence is closed.
State gives argument. Requesting Bound over.
Attorney Ryan requests probable cause not be found.
Victim not in court.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds her over to stand trial on the charges on both files.

State requesting Arraignment date.

Adj.  2:29PM
Arraignment scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant April K Garcia in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane, on behalf of Attorney Josh Ryan, in court for April K Garcia.  Preliminary Hearing rights given and hearing requested.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant April K Garcia in court. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant referred to SPD. Minutes filed.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM T.W. EXCEPT FOR PROFESSIONAL CONTACT. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant April K Garcia in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared. Unclear if defendant qualifies for SPD. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
